revised_title: Investigating the Causes and Effects of Frosts, Heats, Winds, and Tempests
tldr: The author, Dr. J. Beal, discusses various observations and phenomena related to frosts, heats, winds, and tempests. He explores the causes and effects of these natural occurrences, including the role of underground steams, temperature variations, and the impact of different types of stones and waters on the environment. Dr. Beal also suggests the importance of recording weather changes and events for better understanding and predicting future weather patterns.
